Intervention: Participants will participate in a multi-component physical activity intervention for 12 weeks with a follow-up of 6 months.

The topics covered in the book include the benefits of the exercise, recommendations on the type, duration, frequency and intensity of the exercise, setting objectives and advising on how to overcome obstacles.
Fitbit: The subjects received a Fitbit and were instructed to wear the device every day.

The Active Living counselling program consists of 12 weekly group education sessions, which focused on topics related to increased physical activity, including: identifying and overcoming barriers, setting goals, and managing time.
Access to the facility: Subjects will have access to the UT Southwest Depression Centre Exercise Laboratory consisting of aerobic exercise equipment (filters, fixed bikes, etc.).
Eligibility: Positive depression test (PHQ-9) or current antidepressant treatment
Less than 150 minutes of moderate to vigorous weekly physical activity (MVPA) on QMP
Physically able to engage in physical activity
Written and oral motivation in English
A medical condition contraindicates participation in physical activity
Diagnosis of ductal carcinomas in situ (CDIS)
Results: Moderate to vigorous physical activity measured by Actigraphic Accelerometer
To assess changes in physical activity within six months of intervention.
